projectPurpose: To provide a fast, easy-to-use, and flexible tool for visualizing and debugging streams of multimodal and temporal data, particularly relevant for robotics, computer vision, and AI applications.
mainFeatures: Visualize streams of multimodal data (2D, 3D, text, time series, tensors, etc.)
Time-aware data handling and visualization with 'time travel'
SDKs for logging data from C++, Python, and Rust
Live visualization and recording to file (.rrd format)
Native and web-based viewer, embeddable in notebooks and web apps
Query APIs for extracting time-aligned data

alternatives.name: Foxglove Studio
mainFeatures: Visualizes live and recorded data (ROS bags, MCAP)
Customizable layouts with modular panels (3D, images, plots, raw messages)
Extensible via a plugin API and User Scripts

alternatives.name: RViz (ROS Visualization)
mainFeatures: Visualizes sensor data (cameras, lidar, radar) and robot models
Integrated with ROS topics for real-time data
Supports plugins for custom displays, panels, and tools

marketPositioning: Rerun is positioned as a high-performance, flexible, and easy-to-integrate open-source multimodal data visualization and debugging tool with a strong emphasis on temporal data handling. Built in Rust, it offers speed and portability across native and web platforms, and provides SDKs for popular languages like C++, Python, and Rust for seamless data logging. While competitive with robotics-specific tools like Foxglove Studio and RViz, Rerun aims for broader applicability beyond ROS and offers a compelling combination of performance, ease of use, and a focus on time-aware data exploration, targeting developers in robotics, computer vision, and AI. The project also signals a future commercial offering for teams.
